page.title: 03MUNDON AND OSEA-CROPS GROWN
page.content: Farming in this area is almost totally cereal crops. The main crop is wheat. Quite a lot of barley is grown as well as peas,sweetcorn and rapeseed. Some of the soil is not suited to the growing of crops such as potatoes or sugarbeet. Freshfields farm grows only cereals but Iltney farm still has some animals At the moment it has 40 beef cattle and 90 sheep.There are also chickens to supply eggs for the family and one cow to provide the milk. The cereals are sold by the farmer wherever they can get the best price but the sheepskins are collected by the Wool Marketing Board. Farmers have chosen to grow cereals because,until recently,this has been profitable and because they are not tied to the farm as they would be with dairy-farming.
